page.title: 01Stone and its Environment
page.content: The area is a mixture of dairy farming and light industry around the town of Stone, which is the main centre of population with over 12,000 people. Nearby is Oulton village with over 1,000 people.Stone is situated midway between Stafford and Stoke-on-Trent, being 8 miles from each.London is 149 miles away.The town is well served with shops, sports facilities, schools, churches and general amenities.Early closing day is Wednesday.Tuesdays and Saturdays are market days.There is a Cattle Market on Mondays and Thursdays. A regular rail service passes through the town, carrying passengers to Birmingham via Stafford, or Manchester via Stoke. Also regular bus services operate to the surrounding villages and to Stafford, Hanley and Longton. For motorists, car parking is free.
